channel.title: Threads are Stupid! How to make this work?

item.title: Threads are Stupid! How to make this work?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:25, topic:419655”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=522201.msg3804855#msg3804855 date=1320364492]
I considered massive to refer to the size of the game world, not the number of players.
[/quote]It isn’t though. It refers to the amount of players your game can support. Besides, many MUD’s have worlds far bigger than the MMORPGs of today, including Darkfall (which basically has the biggest MMORPG world out there)[/quote]

Well then, let’s just consider it a difference of game eras.

Read full topic

item.title: Threads are Stupid! How to make this work?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:20, topic:419655”]Some MUDs played very similar to current MMORPGS tbh. It seems silly to lump them all together when they were very different. I played a MUD years ago that was very building focused even, with player built areas and quests from inside the MUD.

MUDCRAFT? :P[/quote]Sounds like UO to me.

EDIT: My point being, MMORPG is a very vague genre as well, so it isn’t all that different.

item.title: Threads are Stupid! How to make this work?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:18, topic:419655”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=522201.msg3803338#msg3803338 date=1320247580]

runescape would disagree given that it was called deviousmud once

DeviusMUD was multiplayer and graphical. I’m confused.

Yeah I meant they’d disagree with Johan, agree with you.
[/quote]If it has Graphics, why not simply call it an MMORPG? That’s essentially what all MMO’s are anyway.

But there are given criteria needed for MMORPGs not all graphical MUDs fulfill. For example, I don’t think any MUD could be considered massive, and they are not specifically required to be a RPG. They aren’t even much of a game. They are more of a multiplayer and online shell of a game.

Edit: I have this preconception ‘MUD’ is also a legacy term. I personally don’t really hear about people making them much anymore. It seems people just jump straight to massive, multiplayer, online, and game all in one move.[/quote]MUD’s were definitely “massive”, many of them had thousands of concurrent players. The argument of not being much of a game could be said for many MMO’s as well, specifically ones who act more like a chat room.

And yes, it is a legacy term, it wasn’t until Richard Garriott coined the term “MMORPG” that it was abandoned.

Read full topic
item.source: Threads are Stupid! How to make this work?

http://www.mudconnect.com/mud_graphical.html

item.source: Threads are Stupid! How to make this work?

item.title: Threads are Stupid! How to make this work?
item.dc:creator: @DonnyB4e56 DonnyB4e56
item.description:
@DonnyB4e56 wrote:


package com.mud.client;

import java.net.*;
import java.io.*;

public class ConnectionHandler extends Client implements Runnable{
    
    static int pid;
    static Socket socket;
    static DataInputStream in;
    static DataOutputStream out;
    static String host = "localhost";
    static int PORT = 7777;
    public ConnectionHandler(){
        try {
            socket = new Socket(host,PORT);
            in = new DataInputStream(socket.getInputStream());
            out = new DataOutputStream(socket.getOutputStream());
            pid = in.readInt();
            player[pid] = new Player();
            player[pid].setPos(x,y);
        } catch (UnknownHostException ex) {} catch (IOException ex) {}
    }

    public void run() {
        Output test = new Output(socket,out);
        test.start();
        while(true){
            try {
                Thread.sleep(200);
            } catch (InterruptedException ex) {}
            try {
                int pida = in.readInt();
                int xa = in.readInt();
                int ya = in.readInt();
                System.out.println("received");
                if (player[pida] != null){
                player[pida].setPos(xa, ya);
                }
                else if (player[pida]== null){
                player[pida] = new Player();
                player[pida].setPos(xa, ya);
                }
            } catch (IOException ex) {}
            }
    }
    
}
class Output extends Thread{

    Socket socket;
    DataOutputStream out;
    public Output(Socket socket, DataOutputStream out){
        this.out = out;
        this.socket = socket;
    }
    public void run(){
        
        while(true){
            try {
                Thread.sleep(200);
            } catch (InterruptedException ex) {}
            try {
                out.writeInt(ConnectionHandler.pid);
                out.writeInt(ConnectionHandler.x);
                out.writeInt(ConnectionHandler.y);
                System.out.println("sent");
            } catch (IOException ex) {}
        }
    }
    
}

Read full topic
item.source: Threads are Stupid! How to make this work?

item.title: Threads are Stupid! How to make this work?
item.dc:creator: @DonnyB4e56 DonnyB4e56
item.description:
@DonnyB4e56 wrote:

Sorry that’s the wrong code,

package com.mud.client;

import java.applet.Applet;
import java.awt.*;
import java.util.*;

public class Client extends Applet{
    
    Thread t = null;
    public Player[] player = new Player[200];
    public static int x,y;
    ConnectionHandler handle;

    public void init(){
        handle = new ConnectionHandler();
        handle.run();
        Timer t = new Timer();
        t.schedule(new TimerTask(){public void run(){
        repaint();
        }}, 100, 100);
    }
    public void paint(Graphics g){
        for (int i = 0; i < 200; i++){
            if(player[i] != null){
        player[i].drawPlayer(g);
            }
        }
    }
}

The loops in my connection handler take over and will not let the timer do its job.

Read full topic
